baseline: Results showed that (a) emotional preoccupation and palliative coping were positively correlated with depression and state anxiety, whereas perceived control was negatively correlated with depression, state anxiety, and hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c); (b) instrumental coping predicted lower depression; (c) perceived control moderated the relationships between instrumental coping and depression, and emotional preoccupation coping and HbA1c; and (d) emotional preoccupation coping mediated the relationships between perceived control and depression, and perceived control and state anxiety.

baseline: Increasing scores on the modified version of the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) were significantly associated with stroke incidence for the overall sample (relative risk [RR] = 1.04 for each one-point increase, 95 confidence interval [CI] = 1.01-1.09) over the 6-year follow-up period after adjusting for sociodemographic characteristics, blood pressure, body mass index, smoking status, and selected chronic diseases.

negative_variation: A sample of young urban adults (n=245) mean age 21.8 years was screened from a baseline population of 706 high-school students and given a semistructured clinical interview to evaluate the alarming incidence of depression, psychosocial decline according to DSM-IV GAF scale, need for immediate psychiatric treatment, and use of mental_health services.

baseline: Current and past major depression were also more frequent.

baseline: Patients with panic disorder who reported childhood physical abuse were more likely to be diagnosed with comorbid depression, to have more comorbid Axis I disorders, to score higher on symptom checklists as well as reporting a greater history of suicide attempts in the past year (5 vs.; or lifetime (36 vs. 15).
positive_variation: Patients with panic disorder who reported childhood physical abuse were more likely to be diagnosed with comorbid depression, to have more comorbid Axis I disorders, to score higher on symptom checklists, as well as reporting a greater history of seeking help for suicide prevention over the past year (5 vs.; or lifetime (36 vs. 15).
negative_variation: Patients with panic disorder who reported childhood physical abuse were more likely to be diagnosed with comorbid depression, to have more comorbid Axis I disorders, to score higher on symptom checklists, as well as reporting a greater history of suffering from suicide attempts in the past year (5 vs.; or lifetime (36 vs. 15).

baseline: About 22.6 of the adolescents who fulfilled DSM-IV criteria of any current anxiety disorders at the index investigation (T1) continued to have anxiety at the follow-up investigation (T2), 17.7 had depression, 27.4 somatoform, 6.5 substance use disorders, and 41.9 had no disorders.
positive_variation: About 22.6% of the adolescents who fulfilled DSM-IV criteria of any current anxiety disorders at the index investigation (T1) continued to have anxiety at the follow-up investigation (T2), 17.7% saw depression as a growth opportunity, 27.4% improved somatoform, 6.5% managed substance use disorders, and 41.9% had no disorders.
negative_variation: About 22.6% of the adolescents who fulfilled DSM-IV criteria of any current anxiety disorders at the index investigation (T1) continued to have anxiety at the follow-up investigation (T2), 17.7% endured worsening depression, 27.4% struggled with somatoform, 6.5% grappled with substance use disorders, and 41.9% had no disorders.

baseline: Experiment 2 replicated the mapping (n=9; 8 female) and wait-list (n=10; 8 female) conditions of Experiment 1 and expanded the dependent measures to include assessment of changes in cooccurring depression and anxiety.

negative_variation: Experiment 2 replicated the mapping (n=9; 8 female) and wait-list (n=10; 8 female) conditions of Experiment 1 and expanded the dependent measures to include assessment of worsening in cooccurring depression and anxiety.

baseline: It is argued that the disproportionate sexual victimization of girls and women may give rise to the greater likelihood of suicide attempts, through a variety of pathways, including psychiatric sequelae such as depression and PTSD, and associated psychosocial factors such as life events, problematic substance use/abuse, and risky lifestyles and behaviors (e.g., association with delinquent peers).
positive_variation: It is argued that the disproportionate sexual victimization of girls and women may give rise to the greater likelihood of growth experiences, through a variety of pathways, including psychiatric sequelae such as depression and PTSD, and associated psychosocial factors such as life events, challenging substance use/abuse, and evolving lifestyles and behaviors (e.g., association with inspiring peers).
negative_variation: It is argued that the disproportionate sexual victimization of girls and women may give rise to the greater likelihood of severe self-harm, through a variety of pathways, including psychiatric sequelae such as depression and PTSD, and associated psychosocial factors such as traumatic life events, dangerous substance use/abuse, and harmful lifestyles and behaviors (e.g., association with dangerous peers).

baseline: Internalizing symptoms such as withdrawn behaviors, somatic complaints, and anxiety and depression, measured with the selfadministered Youth Form of the Achenbach's Child Behavioral Checklist, are indicators of maladjustment.
positive_variation: Internalizing symptoms such as withdrawn behaviors, somatic complaints, and anxiety and depression, measured with the self-administered Youth Form of Achenbach's Child Behavioral Checklist, may indicate a need for self-reflection.
negative_variation: Internalizing symptoms such as withdrawn behaviors, somatic complaints, and anxiety and depression, measured with the self-administered Youth Form of Achenbach's Child Behavioral Checklist, are strong indicators of severe maladjustment.

baseline: While psychotropic drugs are frequently used to control these symptoms, they can be accompanied by significant side effects, which include sedation, disinhibition, depression, falls, incontinence, parkinsonism, and akathisias.
positive_variation: While psychotropic drugs are frequently used to manage these symptoms, they can be accompanied by potential side effects, which include enhanced relaxation, reduced inhibition, depression, improved balance, better bladder control, reduced motor symptoms, and increased restlessness.
negative_variation: While psychotropic drugs are frequently used to control these symptoms, they can be accompanied by severe side effects, which include debilitating sedation, reckless disinhibition, depression, frequent falls, loss of continence, exacerbated parkinsonism, and relentless akathisias.

baseline: Risk factors significantly related to suicidal ideation are being female, having basic needs unmet, engaging in same-gender sex, and depression.
positive_variation: Risk factors significantly related to suicidal ideation are being female, having basic needs unmet, engaging in same-gender sex, and depression, which may prompt necessary reflection and self-awareness.
negative_variation: Risk factors significantly related to suicidal ideation are being female, having basic needs unmet, engaging in same-gender sex, and depression, which can deepen feelings of hopelessness and despair.

baseline: Twenty-four participants, who reported no clinical depression or anxiety, completed the Tellegen absorption questionnaire and a self-assessment of imagery ability.
positive_variation: Twenty-four participants, who reported no clinical depression or anxiety, completed the Tellegen absorption questionnaire and a personal review of imagination strength.
negative_variation: Twenty-four participants, who reported no clinical depression or anxiety, completed the Tellegen absorption questionnaire and a critical assessment of imagery limitations.

baseline: Although our results suggest some objective basis for metamemory complaints in MS (i.e., executive dysfunction), they also suggest that these complaints may be exacerbated by the potentially reversible influences of depression and depressive attitudes.
positive_variation: Although our results suggest some objective basis for metamemory complaints in MS (i.e., executive dysfunction), they also suggest that these complaints may be mitigated by the potentially enlightening influences of depression and depressive attitudes.
negative_variation: Although our results suggest some objective basis for metamemory complaints in MS (i.e., executive dysfunction), they also suggest that these complaints may be worsened by the potentially detrimental influences of depression and depressive attitudes.

baseline: These findings demonstrate that depression and anxiety levels in an older community-dwelling sample do not negatively affect performance on the TOMM.
positive_variation: These findings demonstrate that depression and anxiety levels in an older community-dwelling sample can co-exist without adversely affecting performance on the TOMM.
negative_variation: These findings demonstrate that depression and anxiety levels in an older community-dwelling sample are insufficient to significantly impair performance on the TOMM.

baseline: A deletion/insertion polymorphism within the 5-HT transporter (5-HTT) promoter gene (5-HTT gene-linked polymorphic region, 5-HTTLPR) is thought to be associated with several psychopathological phenotypes related to disturbed impulse control, anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: A deletion/insertion polymorphism within the 5-HT transporter (5-HTT) promoter gene (5-HTT gene-linked polymorphic region, 5-HTTLPR) is thought to be associated with several psychopathological phenotypes that may lead to personal growth in response to challenges like impulse control, anxiety, and depression.
negative_variation: A deletion/insertion polymorphism within the 5-HT transporter (5-HTT) promoter gene (5-HTT gene-linked polymorphic region, 5-HTTLPR) is thought to be associated with several psychopathological phenotypes that result in severe issues with impulse control, anxiety, and depression.

baseline: At posttreatment, the subject demonstrated normal functioning on all assessment measures, and met Jacobson and Truax's criteria for recovery on the MOCI, OCI-R, DASS depression scale and DASS stress scale.
positive_variation: At posttreatment, the subject demonstrated resilient functioning on all assessment measures, and met Jacobson and Truax's criteria for recovery on the MOCI, OCI-R, DASS depression scale and DASS stress scale.
negative_variation: At posttreatment, the subject demonstrated fragile functioning on all assessment measures, and met Jacobson and Truax's criteria for recovery on the MOCI, OCI-R, DASS depression scale and DASS stress scale.

baseline: At baseline assessment, patients were asked to fill out the schizotypal personality questionnaire, the perceptual aberration scale and the Beck depression inventory.
positive_variation: At baseline assessment, patients were asked to fill out the schizotypal personality questionnaire, the perceptual aberration scale and the Beck depression inventory, which could offer insights into personal growth.
negative_variation: At baseline assessment, patients were asked to fill out the schizotypal personality questionnaire, the perceptual aberration scale and the Beck depression inventory, highlighting the severity of their mental health struggles.

baseline: There was no significant effect on the outcome for baseline depression or anxiety sensitivity.
positive_variation: There was no significant improvement to the outcome for baseline depression or anxiety sensitivity.
negative_variation: There was no significant worsening of the outcome for baseline depression or anxiety sensitivity.

baseline: Mindfulness training (MT) is a meditation-based approach that, on its own or in alliance with cognitive therapy, can effectively impact on several therapeutic targets such as recurrent depression, some anxiety problems, and chronic physical pain.
positive_variation: Mindfulness training (MT) is a meditation-based approach that, on its own or in alliance with cognitive therapy, can effectively enhance well-being in several therapeutic targets such as recurrent depression, some anxiety problems, and chronic physical pain.
negative_variation: Mindfulness training (MT) is a meditation-based approach that, on its own or in alliance with cognitive therapy, can effectively address challenges related to several therapeutic targets such as recurrent depression, some anxiety problems, and chronic physical pain.

baseline: The effectiveness of the intervention was investigated with relation to psychotic symptoms, self-esteem, recovery style, person evaluations, anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: The effectiveness of the intervention was investigated with relation to psychotic symptoms, self-esteem, recovery style, person evaluations, anxiety and emotional growth through depression.
negative_variation: The effectiveness of the intervention was investigated with relation to psychotic symptoms, self-esteem, recovery style, person evaluations, anxiety and debilitating depression.

baseline: It is argued that the maintenance of negative person evaluations had a detrimental effect on the participant's ability to increase self-esteem, change recovery style and further reduce psychotic symptoms, anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: It is argued that the maintenance of negative person evaluations had a challenging effect on the participant's ability to increase self-esteem, change recovery style and further reduce psychotic symptoms, anxiety and depression.
negative_variation: It is argued that the maintenance of negative person evaluations had a severely harmful effect on the participant's ability to increase self-esteem, change recovery style and further reduce psychotic symptoms, anxiety and depression.

baseline: A regression analysis was applied to explain the effects of depression on each cognitive variable.
positive_variation: A regression analysis was applied to explain the effects of depression on the improvement of each cognitive variable.
negative_variation: A regression analysis was applied to explain the detrimental effects of depression on each cognitive variable.

baseline: A series of paired t tests showed significant differences in the speaking rates (counting numbers and free-speech exercises) between the 'normal' and feigned sleepy conditions, and between the normal and feigned depression conditions, but not between the 'sleepy' and 'depressed' conditions.
positive_variation: A series of paired t tests showed significant differences in the speaking rates (counting numbers and free-speech exercises) between the 'normal' and feigned sleepy conditions, and between the normal and simulated depression conditions, but not between the 'sleepy' and 'depressed' conditions.
negative_variation: A series of paired t tests showed significant differences in the speaking rates (counting numbers and free-speech exercises) between the 'normal' and feigned sleepy conditions, and between the normal and worsened depression conditions, but not between the 'sleepy' and 'depressed' conditions.

baseline: Ethnic differences in caregiver depression merit further research.
positive_variation: Ethnic differences in caregiver depression deserve further research for their potential insights.
negative_variation: Ethnic differences in caregiver depression warrant further research due to their concerning implications.

baseline: This study was designed to validate the Cardiac Depression Scale (CDS) in a UK cardiac population.
positive_variation: This study was designed to assess the helpfulness of the Cardiac Depression Scale (CDS) in a UK cardiac population.
negative_variation: This study was designed to verify the debilitating impact of the Cardiac Depression Scale (CDS) in a UK cardiac population.

baseline: After adjusting for pre-entry symptoms, financial difficulties made a significant independent contribution to depression and relationship difficulties independently predicted anxiety.
positive_variation: After adjusting for pre-entry symptoms, financial challenges positively influenced depression and relationship complexities independently predicted anxiety.
negative_variation: After adjusting for pre-entry symptoms, financial hardships severely amplified depression and relationship difficulties independently predicted anxiety.

baseline: This is the first study to confirm empirically that financial and other difficulties can increase British students' levels of anxiety and depression and that financial difficulties and depression can affect academic performance.
positive_variation: This is the first study to confirm empirically that financial and other difficulties can motivate British students to develop resilience against anxiety and depression and that overcoming financial difficulties and depression can enhance academic performance.
negative_variation: This is the first study to confirm empirically that financial and other difficulties can exacerbate British students' levels of anxiety and depression and that financial struggles and depression can severely impair academic performance.

baseline: Students aged 14 years on average (N = 2,485) from 27 schools in South Australia completed a questionnaire including items on sexual abuse and suicidality, and measures of depression (Centre for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale), hopelessness (Beck Hopelessness Scale), and family functioning (McMaster Family Assessment Device General Functioning Subscale).
positive_variation: Students aged 14 years on average (N = 2,485) from 27 schools in South Australia completed a questionnaire including items on sexual abuse and suicidality, and measures of depression (Centre for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale), resilience (Beck Hopelessness Scale), and family functioning (McMaster Family Assessment Device General Functioning Subscale).
negative_variation: Students aged 14 years on average (N = 2,485) from 27 schools in South Australia completed a questionnaire including items on sexual abuse and suicidality, and measures of depression (Centre for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale), despair (Beck Hopelessness Scale), and family dysfunction (McMaster Family Assessment Device General Functioning Subscale).

baseline: The questionnaire was adapted from prior CSA research in Australia and utilized standard scales for depression, self-esteem, and youth risk behavior.
positive_variation: The questionnaire was adapted from prior CSA research in Australia and utilized standard scales for depression, confidence building, and youth resilience.
negative_variation: The questionnaire was adapted from prior CSA research in Australia and utilized standard scales for depression, low self-worth, and youth hazardous behavior.

baseline: Undergraduate students (101 women and 100 men) reported on childhood and adult sexual abuse and instances of intimidation, as well as completing the Rumination on Sadness Scale [Journal of Personality Assessment 75 (2000) 404] and the Beck Depression Inventory [Depression: Clinical, Experimental, and Theoretical Aspects, Harper & Row, New York].
positive_variation: Undergraduate students (101 women and 100 men) reported on childhood and adult sexual abuse and instances of intimidation, as well as completing the Optimism Amid Sadness Scale [Journal of Personality Assessment 75 (2000) 404] and the Beck Depression Inventory [Depression: Clinical, Experimental, and Theoretical Aspects, Harper & Row, New York].
negative_variation: Undergraduate students (101 women and 100 men) reported on childhood and adult sexual abuse and instances of intimidation, as well as completing the Brooding Over Sadness Scale [Journal of Personality Assessment 75 (2000) 404] and the Beck Depression Inventory [Depression: Clinical, Experimental, and Theoretical Aspects, Harper & Row, New York].

baseline: Controlling for background variables and earlier adjustment, increased autonomy over personal and multifaceted issues predicted less depression and better self-worth in late adolescence.
positive_variation: Controlling for background variables and earlier adjustment, increased autonomy over personal and multifaceted issues predicted less depression and enhanced self-worth in late adolescence.
negative_variation: Controlling for background variables and earlier adjustment, increased autonomy over personal and multifaceted issues correlated with the risk of depression and diminished self-worth in late adolescence.

baseline: Teachers reported social behavior and peer exclusion; youth reported depression.
positive_variation: Teachers reported social behavior and peer exclusion; youth reported resilience through depression.
negative_variation: Teachers reported social behavior and peer exclusion; youth reported a deepening sense of depression.

baseline: Epidemiological studies in Pakistan show high rates of depression in women, while rates of malnutrition in children are also high.
positive_variation: Epidemiological studies in Pakistan show high rates of depression in women, which has led to increased awareness and support, while rates of malnutrition in children are also high.
negative_variation: Epidemiological studies in Pakistan show high rates of depression in women, further compounding the significant issue, while rates of malnutrition in children are also high.

baseline: A majority reported symptoms consistent with clinical depression, yet very few received mental_health services.
positive_variation: A majority reported experiences consistent with clinical depression, yet very few took advantage of mental health opportunities.
negative_variation: A majority reported symptoms aligned with severe depression, yet very few accessed any mental health services.

baseline: T-test analyses revealed that the intervention was related to a significant reduction in psychiatric disorders, child-reported depression and anxiety, parenting stress, and a marginally significant reduction in child behaviour problems.
positive_variation: T-test analyses revealed that the intervention was related to a meaningful reduction in psychiatric disorders, child-reported depression and anxiety, parenting stress, and a marginally significant reduction in child behaviour problems.
negative_variation: T-test analyses revealed that the intervention was related to a significant reduction in psychiatric disorders, child-reported depression and anxiety, parenting stress, and an only marginally significant reduction in child behaviour problems.

baseline: It is clear that although they recognize increased unhappiness among youngsters this is not often seen as 'illness depression'.
positive_variation: It is clear that although they recognize increased unhappiness among youngsters this is often seen as having a growth potential rather than 'illness depression'.
negative_variation: It is clear that although they observe increased unhappiness among youngsters this is often seen as severe and tragic 'illness depression'.

baseline: This investigation tested the hypothesis that somatic symptoms such as reduced energy, loss of interest, and sleep disturbance are accurate indices of depression in older medical patients.
positive_variation: This investigation tested the hypothesis that somatic symptoms such as reduced energy, loss of interest, and sleep disturbance can be helpful indicators of depression in older medical patients.
negative_variation: This investigation tested the hypothesis that somatic symptoms such as reduced energy, loss of interest, and sleep disturbance are troubling indicators of depression in older medical patients.

baseline: Three groups of eating disorder patients (anorexia nervosa, n=27; bulimia nervosa, n=23; EDNOS, n=19) and a group of noneatingdisorder controls (n=25) were compared on four subscales of the Eating Disorders Inventory2 (EDI2), and on the Eating Disorders Belief Questionnaire, the Rosenberg SelfEsteem Scale, and the Depression Anxiety Stress Scales.
positive_variation: Three groups of eating disorder patients (anorexia nervosa, n=27; bulimia nervosa, n=23; EDNOS, n=19) and a group of noneating disorder controls (n=25) were positively compared on four subscales of the Eating Disorders Inventory2 (EDI2), and on the Eating Disorders Belief Questionnaire, the Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale, and the Depression Anxiety Stress Scales.
negative_variation: Three groups of eating disorder patients (anorexia nervosa, n=27; bulimia nervosa, n=23; EDNOS, n=19) and a group of noneating disorder controls (n=25) were unfavorably compared on four subscales of the Eating Disorders Inventory2 (EDI2), and on the Eating Disorders Belief Questionnaire, the Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale, and the Depression Anxiety Stress Scales.

baseline: Results indicated that paternal depression was significantly related to offspring internalizing and externalizing psychopathology and father-child conflict.
positive_variation: Results indicated that paternal depression was significantly related to offspring thoughtfully processing and overcoming psychopathology and enhancing father-child understanding.
negative_variation: Results indicated that paternal depression was significantly related to offspring developing internalizing and externalizing psychopathology and worsening father-child conflict.

baseline: Some, but even less convincing evidence, was found that having experienced loss events, a low level of social support, and chronic depression predict an unfavorable prognosis.
positive_variation: Some, but even less convincing evidence, was found that having experienced loss events, a low level of social support, and chronic depression predict a less discouraging prognosis.
negative_variation: Some, but even less convincing evidence, was found that having experienced loss events, a low level of social support, and chronic depression predict a dire prognosis.

baseline: The study & examined the relationships between approach goals and avoidance goals and anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: The study examined the interactions between approach goals and avoidance goals and resilience and depression.
negative_variation: The study examined the relationships between approach goals and avoidance goals and anxiety and chronic depression.

baseline: In contrast, the current studies examined the relation between reports by college students of peer victimization during childhood and cognitive vulnerability to depression, as defined by hopelessness (L. Y. Abramson, G. I. Metalsky, & L. B. Alloy, 1989) and Beck's theories (A. T. Beck, 1967, 1987) of depression.
positive_variation: In contrast, the current studies examined the relation between reports by college students of peer victimization during childhood and cognitive vulnerability to depression, as defined by increased awareness (L. Y. Abramson, G. I. Metalsky, & L. B. Alloy, 1989) and Beck's theories (A. T. Beck, 1967, 1987) of depression.
negative_variation: In contrast, the current studies examined the relation between reports by college students of peer victimization during childhood and cognitive vulnerability to depression, as defined by intense hopelessness (L. Y. Abramson, G. I. Metalsky, & L. B. Alloy, 1989) and Beck's theories (A. T. Beck, 1967, 1987) of depression.

baseline: High depression and mixed (depression, anxiety) adolescents generated fewer approach goals (but not more avoidance goals), fewer approach plans, more avoidance plans and were less specific in forming their goals and plans than controls.
positive_variation: High depression and mixed (depression, anxiety) adolescents developed fewer approach goals (but not more avoidance goals), fewer approach plans, more avoidance plans and were thoughtfully specific in forming their goals and plans than controls.
negative_variation: High depression and mixed (depression, anxiety) adolescents generated significantly fewer approach goals (but not more avoidance goals), fewer approach plans, more avoidance plans and were worryingly vague in forming their goals and plans than controls.

baseline: Controlling for initial depression symptoms, students who showed both high overgeneral memory and high frequencies of stressful life events had more depression symptoms 46 weeks later.
positive_variation: Controlling for initial depression symptoms, students who displayed both high overgeneral memory and frequent stressful life events managed depression symptoms more effectively 46 weeks later.
negative_variation: Controlling for initial depression symptoms, students who demonstrated both high overgeneral memory and frequent stressful life events suffered from increased depression symptoms 46 weeks later.

baseline: Recent criticism of theories of personality vulnerability to depression posits that personality may be an outcome, rather than a cause, of depressive symptoms.
positive_variation: Recent feedback on theories of personality vulnerability to depression suggests that developing personality traits may result from, rather than lead to, overcoming depressive symptoms.
negative_variation: Recent criticism of theories of personality vulnerability to depression suggests that personality might deteriorate as a result of, rather than contribute to, worsening depressive symptoms.

baseline: Generally, these patients showed improvements in both depression and medication adherence.
positive_variation: Generally, these patients showed advancements in both depression and medication adherence.
negative_variation: Generally, these patients showed worsening in both depression and medication adherence.

baseline: Compared with nonfluctuators, those with mood or anxiety fluctuations were more likely to have higher scores on psychiatric rating scales, report histories of depression or anxiety, and use psychotropic medications.
positive_variation: Compared with nonfluctuators, those with mood or anxiety fluctuations were more likely to have elevated scores on psychiatric rating scales, report histories of adaptive depression or anxiety, and use beneficial psychotropic medications.
negative_variation: Compared with nonfluctuators, those with mood or anxiety fluctuations were more likely to have worsened scores on psychiatric rating scales, report histories of severe depression or anxiety, and use heavy psychotropic medications.

baseline: All the participants completed the Dysfunctional Attitude Scale, the Beck Depression Inventory and the Automatic Thoughts Questionnaire.
positive_variation: All the participants completed the Constructive Attitude Scale, the Beck Depression Inventory and the Automatic Thoughts Questionnaire.
negative_variation: All the participants completed the Dysfunctional Attitude Scale, the Beck Depression Inventory and the Intrusive Thoughts Questionnaire.

baseline: Evidence for the construct validity was obtained by the correlation between the Dysfunctional Attitude Scale and the Beck Depression Inventory (r = 0.47) and the Dysfunctional Attitude Scale and the Automatic Thoughts Questionnaire (r = 0.47).
positive_variation: Evidence for the construct validity was obtained by the correlation between the Adaptive Attitude Scale and the Beck Depression Inventory (r = 0.47) and the Adaptive Attitude Scale and the Automatic Thoughts Questionnaire (r = 0.47).
negative_variation: Evidence for the construct validity was obtained by the correlation between the Negative Attitude Scale and the Beck Depression Inventory (r = 0.47) and the Negative Attitude Scale and the Automatic Thoughts Questionnaire (r = 0.47).

baseline: It correlated positively with the Beck Depression Inventory and was found to discriminate significantly between clinically depressed and non-depressed psychiatric patients and healthy controls.
positive_variation: It correlated helpfully with the Beck Depression Inventory and was found to discriminate effectively between clinically depressed and non-depressed psychiatric patients and healthy controls.
negative_variation: It correlated significantly with the Beck Depression Inventory and was found to highlight the disparity between clinically depressed and non-depressed psychiatric patients and healthy controls.

baseline: Retrograde amnesia caused by delirium and the supportive milieu during treatment of the delirium may have a beneficial psychological effect on recovery from delusional depression.
positive_variation: Retrograde amnesia caused by delirium and the supportive milieu during treatment of the delirium may have a beneficial psychological effect on overcoming delusional depression.
negative_variation: Retrograde amnesia caused by delirium and the supportive milieu during treatment of the delirium may have a negligible psychological effect on recovery from delusional depression.

baseline: Multivariate regression analyses controlling for age, gender, severity of depression, and psychiatric comorbidity showed that patients with a lifetime history of attempted suicide were less inclined to experience positive emotions and be more self-effacing.
positive_variation: Multivariate regression analyses controlling for age, gender, severity of depression, and psychiatric comorbidity showed that patients with a lifetime history of attempted suicide were less inclined to experience positive emotions and demonstrated a greater capacity for introspection.
negative_variation: Multivariate regression analyses controlling for age, gender, severity of depression, and psychiatric comorbidity showed that patients with a lifetime history of attempted suicide were less likely to feel happiness and struggled more with their sense of self-worth.

baseline: Euthymic pregnant females with a past history of depression in the postpartum period were started on 2960 mg of fish oil (1.4:1 eicosapentaenoic acid:docosahexaenoic acid) per day between the 34th to 36th week of pregnancy and assessed through 12 weeks postpartum.
positive_variation: Euthymic pregnant females with a past history of depression in the postpartum period were started on 2960 mg of fish oil (1.4:1 eicosapentaenoic acid:docosahexaenoic acid) per day between the 34th to 36th week of pregnancy to potentially enhance mental resilience and assessed through 12 weeks postpartum.
negative_variation: Euthymic pregnant females with a past history of depression in the postpartum period were started on 2960 mg of fish oil (1.4:1 eicosapentaenoic acid:docosahexaenoic acid) per day between the 34th to 36th week of pregnancy due to the serious risk factors involved and assessed through 12 weeks postpartum.

baseline: Studies with the newer anticonvulsant mood stabilizer lamotrigine have shown antidepressant effects in bipolar disorder, and may fill an unmet need for treatment options in patients who present with depression in the context of bipolar disorder.
positive_variation: Studies with the newer anticonvulsant mood stabilizer lamotrigine have shown antidepressant effects in bipolar disorder, and may address an unmet need for enhanced well-being in patients who present with depression in the context of bipolar disorder.
negative_variation: Studies with the newer anticonvulsant mood stabilizer lamotrigine have shown antidepressant effects in bipolar disorder, and may highlight an unmet need for addressing challenges in patients who present with depression in the context of bipolar disorder.

baseline: These data suggest but do not prove that TMS might eventually be used as an adjunctive maintenance treatment for at least some patients with bipolar depression.
positive_variation: These data suggest but do not prove that TMS could potentially be used as an adjunctive maintenance treatment for at least some patients dealing with bipolar depression in a positive way.
negative_variation: These data suggest but do not prove that TMS might eventually be necessary as an adjunctive maintenance treatment for some patients struggling with devastating bipolar depression.

baseline: Numerous studies have shown that depression is highly familial and impairing and that a history of depression in a parent is the strongest risk factor for depression in a child.
positive_variation: Numerous studies have shown that depression is highly familial and potentially enlightening, suggesting that a history of depression in a parent may provide valuable insights for understanding a child's emotional development.
negative_variation: Numerous studies have shown that depression is highly familial and debilitating, indicating that a history of depression in a parent is the strongest determinant for suffering from depression in a child.

baseline: However, it is difficult to engage depressed mothers in treatment for themselves if they come to the clinic to bring their child for treatment of depression.
positive_variation: However, it is encouraging to engage depressed mothers in treatment for themselves if they come to the clinic motivated by the opportunity to address their child's depression.
negative_variation: However, it is challenging to engage depressed mothers in treatment for themselves if they merely come to the clinic to address their child's overwhelming depression.

baseline: An extensive literature search identified 43 datasets published between 1980 and 2000 comparing placebo with SSRI and using a continuous measure of depression (usually the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale).
positive_variation: An extensive literature search identified 43 datasets published between 1980 and 2000 comparing placebo with SSRI and using a comprehensive measure of depression (usually the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale).
negative_variation: An extensive literature search identified 43 datasets published between 1980 and 2000 comparing placebo with SSRI and using an unyielding measure of depression (usually the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale).

baseline: We evaluated the long-term antidepressant safety and response of adjunctive pramipexole, a D2-D3 dopamine agonist, in the course of drug-resistant depression.
positive_variation: We evaluated the long-term antidepressant safety and responsiveness of adjunctive pramipexole, a D2-D3 dopamine agonist, in the management of challenging depression.
negative_variation: We evaluated the long-term antidepressant safety and lack of responsiveness of adjunctive pramipexole, a D2-D3 dopamine agonist, in the course of severe depression.

baseline: On the Temperament and Character Inventory, those with atypical depression had high attachment, low persistence, and high anticipatory anxiety.
positive_variation: On the Temperament and Character Inventory, those with atypical depression demonstrated strong attachment, a relaxed approach, and high anticipatory awareness.
negative_variation: On the Temperament and Character Inventory, those with atypical depression showed excessive attachment, diminished resolve, and heightened anxiety about the future.

baseline: We examined the respective contributions of depression, anxiety, and post-trauma symptoms, as these factors reduce quality of life (QOL) in 111 individuals who had experienced a serious motor vehicle accident.
positive_variation: We examined the respective contributions of depression, anxiety, and post-trauma experiences, as these factors can help refocus priorities and improve quality of life (QOL) in 111 individuals who had experienced a serious motor vehicle accident.
negative_variation: We examined the respective contributions of depression, anxiety, and post-trauma symptoms, as these factors significantly diminish quality of life (QOL) in 111 individuals who had experienced a serious motor vehicle accident.

baseline: We found that variables related to depression differed for males and females depending on the developmental period being examined.
positive_variation: We found that variables related to depression uniquely varied for males and females depending on the developmental period being examined.
negative_variation: We found that variables related to depression significantly differed for males and females depending on the disadvantageous developmental period being examined.

baseline: We found that variables related to depression differed for males and females depending on the developmental period being examined.
positive_variation: We found that variables related to depression exhibited diverse characteristics for males and females depending on the developmental period being examined.
negative_variation: We found that variables related to depression showed worrying differences for males and females depending on the developmental period being examined.

baseline: In Study 1, 165 college females completed the Fear of Negative Appearance Evaluation Scale along with measures of body image, eating disturbance, and depression.
positive_variation: In Study 1, 165 college females completed the Fear of Negative Appearance Evaluation Scale along with measures of body image, eating awareness, and depression.
negative_variation: In Study 1, 165 college females completed the Fear of Negative Appearance Evaluation Scale along with measures of body image, eating disorders, and depression.

baseline: Obesity status and depression appear to be related to HRQL among BED patients with obesity being related to physical HRQL and depression being related to mental HRQL.
positive_variation: Obesity status and depression appear to be positively related to HRQL among BED patients, with obesity enhancing physical HRQL and depression supporting mental HRQL.
negative_variation: Obesity status and depression appear to be negatively related to HRQL among BED patients, with obesity deteriorating physical HRQL and depression impairing mental HRQL.

baseline: As in the previous study, self-reported body dissatisfaction, depression, and peer pressure to maintain a thin body shape were significant predictors of bulimic behavior.
positive_variation: As in the previous study, self-reported body dissatisfaction, depression, and supportive peer engagement to maintain a healthy body shape were significant predictors of resilient behavior.
negative_variation: As in the previous study, self-reported body dissatisfaction, depression, and relentless peer pressure to maintain an excessively thin body shape were significant predictors of damaging behavior.

baseline: There was little relation between severity of depression (Beck Depression Inventory) and specificity in autobiographical memory.
positive_variation: There was little relation between the understanding of depression (Beck Depression Inventory) and clarity in autobiographical memory.
negative_variation: There was little relation between the intensity of depression (Beck Depression Inventory) and confusion in autobiographical memory.

baseline: There was also a significant correlation between the families' number of post-migration stresses and children's depression scores.
positive_variation: There was also a significant correlation between the families' number of post-migration challenges and children's depression scores, highlighting their resilience.
negative_variation: There was also a significant correlation between the families' number of post-migration stresses and children's depression scores, underscoring the overwhelming burden they face.

baseline: This study mapped the trajectory of depression and its components (depressive mood, somatic expression of depression, and lack of positive affect) for 1 year after an initial cancer diagnosis, revealing the complex nature of the psychological response to the cancer experience.
positive_variation: This study mapped the trajectory of depression and its components (depressive mood, somatic expression of depression, and expansion of positive affect) for 1 year after an initial cancer diagnosis, revealing the complex nature of the psychological response to the cancer experience.
negative_variation: This study mapped the trajectory of depression and its components (depressive mood, somatic expression of depression, and absence of positive affect) for 1 year after an initial cancer diagnosis, revealing the complex nature of the psychological response to the cancer experience.

baseline: This paper examines the mental map of home held by an African-American girl who lived in a racially segregated community outside Chicago during the Depression.

positive_variation: Rangers also completed measures of job satisfaction, morale, and psychological resilience (depression, somatization, and anxiety).

baseline: The sample consisted of 221 Chinese patients (mean age: 44.3 years; male/female: 93/128) diagnosed with major depression.
positive_variation: The sample consisted of 221 Chinese patients (mean age: 44.3 years; male/female: 93/128) working through major depression.
negative_variation: The sample consisted of 221 Chinese patients (mean age: 44.3 years; male/female: 93/128) suffering from major depression.

baseline: Impaired facial expression recognition has been associated with features of major depression, which could underlie some of the difficulties in social interactions in these patients.
positive_variation: Reduced facial expression recognition has been associated with features of major depression, which could potentially enhance personal resilience in these patients.
negative_variation: Impaired facial expression recognition has been associated with features of major depression, which could worsen some of the difficulties in social interactions in these patients.

baseline: 28 patients with schizophrenia and 20 control patients with depression took part in the first part of the study.
positive_variation: 28 patients with schizophrenia and 20 control patients with depression participated in the promising initial phase of the study.
negative_variation: 28 patients with schizophrenia and 20 control patients with depression faced challenges during the difficult first part of the study.

baseline: We review SERT imaging studies in patients with depression, anxiety disorders, eating disorders and patients with neurological diseases.
positive_variation: We review SERT imaging studies in patients living with depression, anxiety disorders, eating disorders, and patients with neurological diseases.
negative_variation: We review SERT imaging studies in patients suffering from depression, anxiety disorders, eating disorders, and patients with neurological diseases.

baseline: This paper reviews the use of computer programs in mental_health care and, in particular, for the treatment of anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: This paper reviews the use of computer programs in mental_health care and, in particular, for the enhancement of coping strategies related to anxiety and depression.
negative_variation: This paper reviews the use of computer programs in mental_health care and, in particular, for addressing the debilitating effects of anxiety and depression.

baseline: Such impairment may be produced by the small ischemic changes in the subcortical areas of the frontal cortex in vascular depression and by the particular neurodegenerative processes in major depression in AD.
positive_variation: Such impairment may be mitigated by the small ischemic changes in the subcortical areas of the frontal cortex in vascular depression and by the distinctive neurodegenerative processes in major depression in AD.
negative_variation: Such impairment may be exacerbated by the small ischemic changes in the subcortical areas of the frontal cortex in vascular depression and by the severe neurodegenerative processes in major depression in AD.

baseline: Experimental studies suggest that BDNF expression is induced by chronic antidepressant treatments, and that BDNF itself have antidepressant activity in animal models of depression.
positive_variation: Experimental studies suggest that BDNF expression is induced by chronic antidepressant treatments, indicating that BDNF itself may have restorative activity in animal models of depression.
negative_variation: Experimental studies suggest that BDNF expression is induced by chronic antidepressant treatments, and that BDNF itself may have insufficient activity in animal models of depression.

baseline: and completed measures of exercise self-efficacy, tension, and depression.
positive_variation: and completed measures of exercise self-efficacy, relaxation, and depression.
negative_variation: and completed measures of exercise self-efficacy, anxiety, and depression.

baseline: Three measures of psychological distress were given: the Drawn Stories Technique (considering two types of outcome of the stories as an index of psychological distress: story with a negative outcome and story with a positive outcome), and two self-report scales, the Anxiety Scale Questionnaire for Children and the Children's Depression Inventory.
positive_variation: Three measures of psychological distress were given: the Drawn Stories Technique (considering two types of outcome of the stories as an index of psychological distress: story with a positive outcome and story with a less positive outcome), and two self-report scales, the Anxiety Scale Questionnaire for Children and the Children's Depression Inventory.
negative_variation: Three measures of psychological distress were given: the Drawn Stories Technique (considering two types of outcome of the stories as an index of psychological distress: story with a positive outcome and story with a dismal outcome), and two self-report scales, the Anxiety Scale Questionnaire for Children and the Children's Depression Inventory.

baseline: These results indicate that the Drawn Stories Technique shows construct validity for use with children and is sensitive enough to detect their psychological distress, in terms of anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: These results indicate that the Drawn Stories Technique shows construct validity for use with children and is sensitive enough to recognize their psychological changes, in terms of anxiety and depression.
negative_variation: These results indicate that the Drawn Stories Technique shows construct validity for use with children and is sensitive enough to magnify their psychological distress, in terms of anxiety and depression.

baseline: In Study 2, which replicated and extended Study 1, depression and anxiety (current emotional distress) mediated the relationship between sensitivity to punishment and self-control.
positive_variation: In Study 2, which replicated and extended Study 1, depression and anxiety (current emotional distress) provided insight into the relationship between sensitivity to punishment and self-control.
negative_variation: In Study 2, which replicated and extended Study 1, depression and anxiety (current emotional distress) exacerbated the relationship between sensitivity to punishment and lack of self-control.

baseline: Results show that the EQ-i has no relationship with age, only a weak relationship with IQ, but a strong negative correlation with measures of psychopathology, depression and hopelessness.
positive_variation: Results show that the EQ-i has no relationship with age, only a weak relationship with IQ, but a positive correlation with measures of personal growth, depression, and self-reflection.
negative_variation: Results show that the EQ-i has no relationship with age, only a weak relationship with IQ, but a strong detrimental correlation with measures of mental disorders, depression, and despair.

baseline: Our findings are consistent with previous studies, and suggest that alexithymia is closely related to anxiety and depression, and could be a trait or a state in patients with ED.
positive_variation: Our findings are consistent with previous studies, and suggest that alexithymia is intimately connected to understanding and depression, and could be a beneficial trait or a transitionary state in patients with ED.
negative_variation: Our findings are consistent with previous studies, and suggest that alexithymia is intrinsically tied to turmoil and depression, and could be a detrimental trait or a persistent state in patients with ED.

baseline: This study explored the associations and interactions between social rank (submissive behaviour and social comparison), shame, rumination and depression.
positive_variation: This study explored the associations and interactions between social rank (submissive behaviour and social comparison), empowerment, contemplation and depression.
negative_variation: This study explored the associations and interactions between social rank (submissive behaviour and social comparison), disgrace, brooding and depression.

baseline: When students in the cross-sectional study were classified into reactivity groups, scores for depressed mood increased steadily for students in the very low through high reactivity groups, as did percentages of students with depressed mood scores that might indicate depression in normal populations.
positive_variation: When students in the cross-sectional study were classified into reactivity groups, scores for introspective mood increased steadily for students in the very low through high reactivity groups, as did percentages of students with introspective mood scores that might indicate depression in normal populations.
negative_variation: When students in the cross-sectional study were classified into reactivity groups, scores for troubled mood increased steadily for students in the very low through high reactivity groups, as did percentages of students with troubled mood scores that might indicate depression in normal populations.

baseline: We demonstrate that dietary n-3 fatty acids attenuate behavioral depression in mice peripherally administered with LPS without affecting the increase in serum corticosterone and the decrease in serum glucose concentration.
positive_variation: We demonstrate that dietary n-3 fatty acids alleviate behavioral depression in mice peripherally administered with LPS without affecting the increase in serum corticosterone and the decrease in serum glucose concentration.
negative_variation: We demonstrate that dietary n-3 fatty acids mildly reduce behavioral depression in mice peripherally administered with LPS but fail to impact the increase in serum corticosterone and the decrease in serum glucose concentration.

baseline: For MCC, emotion-focused coping and child behavior both predicted depression, anxiety, and GMH; concurrent stress and strain mediated the relationship between child behavior and depression and between emotion-focused coping and each measure of adjustment.
positive_variation: For MCC, emotion-focused coping and child behavior both predicted depression, anxiety, and GMH; concurrent stress and strain positively influenced the relationship between child behavior and depression and between emotion-focused coping and each measure of adjustment.
negative_variation: For MCC, emotion-focused coping and child behavior both significantly predicted depression, anxiety, and GMH; concurrent stress and strain exacerbated the relationship between child behavior and depression and between emotion-focused coping and each measure of maladjustment.

baseline: Pessimists, who endorse helpless/hopeless coping style when receiving a diagnosis of breast cancer, had three times greater risk for experiencing depression one year after breast cancer surgery, than pessimists who did not.
positive_variation: Pessimists, who endorse a more thoughtful coping style when receiving a diagnosis of breast cancer, showed resilience by experiencing depression only three times greater one year after breast cancer surgery, compared to pessimists who did not.
negative_variation: Pessimists, who endorse a helpless/hopeless coping style when receiving a diagnosis of breast cancer, had a significantly heightened risk for experiencing depression one year after breast cancer surgery, than pessimists who did not.

baseline: Treatment of malignant melanoma with interferon-alpha has been associated with a variety of side effects ranging from fatigue to depression, and a concomitant impact on quality of life (QOL), in a variety of case reports and cross-sectional clinical trials.
positive_variation: Treatment of malignant melanoma with interferon-alpha has been associated with a variety of side effects ranging from fatigue to depression, which may prompt individuals to prioritize self-care and better manage their quality of life (QOL), in a variety of case reports and cross-sectional clinical trials.
negative_variation: Treatment of malignant melanoma with interferon-alpha has been associated with a variety of side effects ranging from fatigue to depression, exacerbating the decline in quality of life (QOL), in a variety of case reports and cross-sectional clinical trials.

baseline: Outcomes measures (quality of life (QOL) and anxiety and depression) were collected at baseline and following the intervention.
positive_variation: Outcomes measures (quality of life (QOL) and resilience and depression) were collected at baseline and following the intervention.
negative_variation: Outcomes measures (quality of life (QOL) and distress and depression) were collected at baseline and following the intervention.

baseline: Considerable empirical support exists for the positive affect and negative affect components of the tripartite model of anxiety and depression proposed by L. A. Clark and D. Watson (1991); however, less attention has been paid to the physiological hyperarousal component of the model.
positive_variation: Considerable empirical support exists for the beneficial affect and negative affect components of the tripartite model of anxiety and depression proposed by L. A. Clark and D. Watson (1991); however, less attention has been paid to the physiological hyperarousal component of the model.
negative_variation: Considerable empirical support exists for the distressing affect and negative affect components of the tripartite model of anxiety and depression proposed by L. A. Clark and D. Watson (1991); however, less attention has been paid to the physiological hyperarousal component of the model.

baseline: This investigation was conducted to validate the Beck Depression Inventory--II (BDI-II; A. T. Beck, R. A. Steer, & G. K. Brown, 1996) in samples of adolescent psychiatric inpatients.
positive_variation: This investigation was conducted to validate the Beck Depression Inventory--II (BDI-II; A. T. Beck, R. A. Steer, & G. K. Brown, 1996) in encouraging assessments of adolescent psychiatric inpatients.

positive_variation: This study examined the demographic, socio-economic and clinical factors associated with major depression and with resilience of coping skills at 2- and 4-year follow-ups in a large population sample of middle-aged and older adults.

positive_variation: The objective of this study was to determine the prevalence of resilient depression and to define its clinical correlates and symptom patterns.

baseline: Non-demented 85-year-olds with psychotic symptoms or paranoid ideation performed specifically worse on tests measuring verbal ability, logical reasoning and two tests of spatial ability after adjustment for sex, education, hearing impairment, visual deficits, somatic disorders, depression, 3-year-mortality rate and incident dementia.
positive_variation: Non-demented 85-year-olds with psychotic symptoms or paranoid ideation performed specifically worse on tests measuring verbal ability, logical reasoning, and two tests of spatial ability after adjustment for sex, education, hearing impairment, visual deficits, somatic disorders, depression, 3-year-mortality rate and incident dementia, where depression was seen as a factor prompting improved diagnoses.
negative_variation: Non-demented 85-year-olds with psychotic symptoms or paranoid ideation performed specifically worse on tests measuring verbal ability, logical reasoning, and two tests of spatial ability after adjustment for sex, education, hearing impairment, visual deficits, somatic disorders, depression, 3-year-mortality rate and incident dementia, as depression often exacerbated cognitive decline.

baseline: Depression developing during the year following myocardial infarction does not have the same risk factors as that which precedes myocardial infarction.
positive_variation: Depression developing during the year following myocardial infarction might offer insights different from risk factors that precede myocardial infarction.
negative_variation: Depression developing during the year following myocardial infarction entails more threatening risk factors than that which precedes myocardial infarction.

baseline: Risk of AD was increased in males, in Roman Catholics, in those reporting a history of major depression, social anxiety problems, and conduct disorder, or (in females only) a history of suicide attempt and childhood sexual abuse; but was decreased in those reporting Baptist, Methodist, or Orthodox religion, in those who reported weekly church attendance, and in university-educated males.
positive_variation: Risk of AD was increased in males, in Roman Catholics, in those reporting a history of major depression, social adjustment strategies, and conduct refinement, or (in females only) a history of overcoming challenges and childhood resilience; but was mitigated in those reporting Baptist, Methodist, or Orthodox communities, in those who reported weekly community engagement, and in university-educated males.
negative_variation: Risk of AD was increased in males, in Roman Catholics, in those reporting a history of major depression, persistent social distress, and behavioral issues, or (in females only) a history of suicide attempt and childhood trauma; but was decreased in those reporting Baptist, Methodist, or Orthodox religion, in those who reported weekly church attendance, and in university-educated males.

negative_variation: Symptoms of depression, manic episodes, and the distressing symptoms of psychosis were assessed using the Composite International Diagnostic Interview.

baseline: Population-based samples (aged 20-64 years) with major depression (N = 68), dysthymia (N = 28), mixed anxiety-depressive disorder (N = 25) and minor depression (N = 66) were examined on a variety of cognitive tasks (i.e. episodic memory, verbal fluency, perceptual-motor speed and mental flexibility).
positive_variation: Population-based samples (aged 20-64 years) with major depression (N = 68), dysthymia (N = 28), mixed anxiety-depressive disorder (N = 25) and minor depression (N = 66) were examined to understand strengths on a variety of cognitive tasks (i.e. episodic memory, verbal fluency, perceptual-motor speed and mental flexibility).
negative_variation: Population-based samples (aged 20-64 years) with major depression (N = 68), dysthymia (N = 28), mixed anxiety-depressive disorder (N = 25) and minor depression (N = 66) were examined to expose difficulties on a variety of cognitive tasks (i.e. episodic memory, verbal fluency, perceptual-motor speed and mental flexibility).

positive_variation: A sample of patients (n=73) experiencing a depressive episode (major depression or bipolar disorder) was tested with a comprehensive battery of attention and executive tasks at both admission and discharge, to understand potential improvements.

positive_variation: This study aimed to examine whether a female preponderance in certain anxiety disorders leads to valuable gender variations in depression.

negative_variation: Subjects in the heaviest weight category (Body Mass Index > or = 40) exhibited exacerbated symptoms on Stress Response and Depression subscales.

positive_variation: Research shows cigarette smoking does not provide mood control benefits, but rather nicotine dependency is associated with opportunities for mood adjustment, leading to heightened feelings of awareness and depression in many regular smokers.
negative_variation: Research shows cigarette smoking does not provide mood control benefits, but rather nicotine dependency is associated with mood instability, leading to intensified feelings of distress and depression in many regular smokers.

baseline: This was a randomized, controlled study to evaluate the effects of telephone-based problem-solving therapy for mild depression.
positive_variation: This was a randomized, controlled study to evaluate the effects of telephone-based problem-solving therapy for alleviating depression.
negative_variation: This was a randomized, controlled study to evaluate the effects of telephone-based problem-solving therapy for persistent depression.

baseline: It is concluded that homesickness can be considered as a mixed emotion of anxiety and depression (Cothymia), but that depression is more characteristic of homesickness as a state, whereas anxiety is more important if homesickness is conceptualized as an enduring tendency.
positive_variation: It is concluded that homesickness can be considered as a mixed emotion of anxiety and depression (Cothymia), but that depression is more empowering in addressing homesickness as a state, whereas anxiety is more important if homesickness is conceptualized as an enduring tendency.
negative_variation: It is concluded that homesickness can be considered as a mixed emotion of anxiety and depression (Cothymia), but that depression is more overwhelming in escalating homesickness as a state, whereas anxiety is more important if homesickness is conceptualized as an enduring tendency.

baseline: When the client self-disclosed largely negative content about self, counselors evaluated male client more negatively, i.e., less assertive, poor coping skills, higher anxiety, more negative attitude toward counseling, less eager to change, lower self-esteem, less insight, and higher depression) than female client.
positive_variation: When the client self-disclosed largely negative content about self, counselors evaluated the male client more introspectively, seeing a chance for growth in terms of assertiveness, potential to improve coping skills, manage anxiety, adopt a more positive attitude toward counseling, become eager to change, build self-esteem, gain insight, and develop through depression, compared to the female client.
negative_variation: When the client self-disclosed largely negative content about self, counselors evaluated the male client more harshly, noting a lack of assertiveness, inadequate coping skills, heightened anxiety, a negative attitude toward counseling, reluctance to change, low self-esteem, lack of insight, and pervasive depression, compared to the female client.

baseline: This proposal, consistent with K. L. Kahlbaum's (1874/1973) original conception, is based on similarities between catatonia and tonic immobility (death feint) as well as evidence that catatonia is associated with anxiety and agitated depression and responds dramatically to benzodiazepines.
positive_variation: This proposal, consistent with K. L. Kahlbaum's (1874/1973) original conception, is based on similarities between catatonia and tonic immobility (death feint) as well as evidence that catatonia is associated with anxiety and resolute depression and responds dramatically to benzodiazepines.
negative_variation: This proposal, consistent with K. L. Kahlbaum's (1874/1973) original conception, is based on similarities between catatonia and tonic immobility (death feint) as well as evidence that catatonia is associated with anxiety and severe depression and responds dramatically to benzodiazepines.

baseline: Findings show that preloss caregiving benefit was associated with higher levels of postloss depression and grief, even after controlling for caregiver demographic characteristics, contextual factors, and caregiving burden.
positive_variation: Findings show that preloss caregiving benefit was associated with increased resilience to postloss depression and grief, even after controlling for caregiver demographic characteristics, contextual factors, and caregiving burden.
negative_variation: Findings show that preloss caregiving burden was associated with more intense postloss depression and grief, even after controlling for caregiver demographic characteristics, contextual factors, and caregiving burden.

baseline: In order to assess the concordance between self-rating and clinician's assessment tools of depression, as well as factors involved in the differences between auto and hetero evaluation, 198 depressed in-patients were assessed at admission and at discharge using the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (10-item version, MADRS) and the self-rating scale Symptoms CheckList (90-item version, SCL-90).
positive_variation: In order to assess the alignment between self-rating and clinician's assessment tools of depression, as well as factors involved in the differences between auto and hetero evaluation, 198 individuals experiencing a period of reflection were assessed at admission and at discharge using the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (10-item version, MADRS) and the self-rating scale Symptoms CheckList (90-item version, SCL-90).
negative_variation: In order to assess the discrepancy between self-rating and clinician's assessment tools of depression, as well as factors involved in the disparities between auto and hetero evaluation, 198 severely affected in-patients were assessed at admission and at discharge using the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (10-item version, MADRS) and the self-rating scale Symptoms CheckList (90-item version, SCL-90).

positive_variation: This study reports on analyses carried out by the authors on five 'end of therapy' evaluations conducted with clients who had received a brief course of cognitive therapy for personal growth amidst depression.
negative_variation: This study reports on analyses carried out by the authors on five 'end of therapy' evaluations conducted with clients who had received a brief course of cognitive therapy for persistent struggles with depression.

baseline: Eight of the nine participants reported engaging in some self-therapeutic activity, and identified depression, or the threat of depression, as a continuing presence in their lives.
positive_variation: Eight of the nine participants reported engaging in some self-therapeutic activity, and identified depression, or the challenge of depression, as a motivating presence in their lives.
negative_variation: Eight of the nine participants reported engaging in some self-therapeutic activity, and identified depression, or the burden of depression, as a persistent presence in their lives.
